result.execSummary:
The defendant KASEY A OAKS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Forfeiture and costs to be paid within 60 days from sentence date, unless payment plan is approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

timeConds.notes:
Imposed and stayed jail, to be used at agents discretion.
With HUBER.
No good time.

records.addlTxt: 8:33 a.m. Defendant KASEY A OAKS in court.  Attorney John Miller Carroll in court for KASEY A OAKS.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case resolved. Advised of rights. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
from Attorney Carroll - case resolved.

1:18 Defendant KASEY A OAKS in court.  Attorney John Miller Carroll in court for KASEY A OAKS.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  No resolution, leave of for Jury Trial.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Bond Continues.
Signed 9/12 with modified conditions.

BATTERY(DV), DC(DV), ENDANGER SAFETY/USE/DANGEROUS WEAPONS(DV), DC(DV)
CONDITIONS:   No VIOLENT contact with V1 in Winnebago County Sheriff's reports 22-1840 & 22-1841.    Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  No possession of firearms.  No possession of dangerous weapons.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.  Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample. Advised of DNA rights.

10:10 AM Defendant KASEY A OAKS in court.  Attorney John Miller Carroll in court for KASEY A OAKS.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  No resolution.  Attorney Carroll requests to modify bond to a no violent contact with V1.  The State stipulates to that.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  The court will modify the bond to no violent contact with V1.  The Court will set a plea/sent prior to trial.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

from attorney Carroll re: scheduling conflict.
The Attorney was in court when this was scheduled, the court will not reschedule the 9/12 date.
